alert.note: Alert for Owen (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 8:50AM EST until February 19 at 2:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following creeks in Indiana... Sugar Creek near Edinburgh Youngs Creek at Amity Mill Creek near Cataract Big Walnut Creek near Reelsville Wildcat Creek near Jerome and at Kokomo .Brief flooding is expected to continue through much of the day for many of the smaller creeks across central Indiana. The most severe flooding will be at Amity where flooding within a foot of moderate flood stage is ongoing and will continue. Other sites will generally remain within a foot or two feet of flood stage and have either crested or nearly crested. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mill Creek near Cataract. * WHEN...From this morning to just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Mill Creek at flood stage. Camp Otto Road begins to flood. Low pasture land along Mill Creek begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM EST Friday the stage was 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 15.5 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued this morning by around 1100 AM EST.
